chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew L Bartley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Effective upon licensure.  Attached is an information sheet for the defendant regarding installation.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and safety plan.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall submit to random drug screens.

Defendant shall notify the agent of any medications currently prescribed and of any change in prescribed medications within 48 hours of the change.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then take medication as prescribed.
Bond amount posted shall be applied.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

Def in person & by Atty Ryan Vieth Doherty.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1,  Court dismissed Count 2 and 15CF59 for read-in.  Court finds def guilty on Count 1.  Statements by counsel and the defendant.  Court enters judgment.
Arraignment at 09-30-2015 11:00 am

Def in person & by Atty Ryan Vieth Doherty.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (15CF59 Br. 2)  State indicates upon plea to Count 1, recommend Count 2 be dismissed for read-in and request PSI with both sides free to argue.  Court questions need for PSI due to length of time needed to complete PSI, statements by counsel and State.  Court adjourns plea/sentencing.  Arraignment scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment at 09-21-2015 08:15 am

Def in person & by Atty Ryan Vieth Doherty.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (15CF59 Br. 2)    Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State files an Information.  Counsel advises are awaiting the blood draw results and expect a report in the next three weeks and hopeful for a global resolution.  Court continues bond.  Arraignment scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing at 07-27-2015 09:30 am
Def in person & by Atty Ryan Vieth Doherty.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing at 07-01-2015 08:15 am

Def in person & by Atty Ryan Vieth Doherty.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  State indicates hope to have report within two to three weeks as of yesterday.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Hearing at 05-29-2015 08:15 am

Def in person & by Atty Ryan Vieth Doherty.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Counsel advises still awaiting blood results.    Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Substitution of Attorneys Consent and Order

Hearing on April 15, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
